thread.title: Armed police rush to incident near Loburn, North Canterbury
thread.title_full: Armed police rush to incident near Loburn, North Canterbury

author: Jack Fletcher
title: Armed police rush to incident near Loburn, North Canterbury
text:
Armed police rush to incident near Loburn, North Canterbury JACK FLETCHER Last updated 15:55, February 22 2017 MAARTEN HOLL/FAIRFAX NZ 
Police have responded to an incident near Loburn, in North Canterbury. 
Armed police have been stood down after reports a woman was being held against her will at a property north of Christchurch. 
Up to 10 police cars and vehicles, some carrying members of the armed offenders squad, were seen heading towards Loburn, North Canterbury, about 1pm on Wednesday. 
A police spokeswoman said they had received a report that a woman was being held against her will by a man she knew. No-one was found at the property when police arrived, and the man and woman were fond safe and well at another address. 
Canterbury metro commander Superintendent Lane Todd said the incident appeared serious at first. 
A cordon was initially set up at the intersection of Hodgsons Rd and Loburn Whiterock Rd, but had since been lifted.
